step_explanation: Step 1 first makes an error in referencing the number of the question description <When he walks, he goes 2 MPH.>. It erroneously references 2 as 1, causing the formula to calculate 4/1=4 instead of 4/2=2. This affects subsequent steps 2, 5, and 6 that reference its result. Step 2 incorrectly calculates 4 x 60=240 instead of 2 x 60=120. Step 5 incorrectly calculates 240+24+24=288 instead of 120+24+24=168. And step 6 incorrectly calculates 288/3=96 instead of 168/3=56. The first step to make a mistake, which is the root cause of the mistake, is step 1, so pred_wrong_step is 1.

Step 3 first makes an error in referencing the number of the question description <When he runs, he goes 10 MPH.>. It erroneously references 10 as 20, causing the formula to calculate 4 / 20 = .2 instead of 4 / 10 = .4. This affects subsequent steps 4, 5, and 6 that reference its result. Step 4 incorrectly calculates .2 x 60 = 12 instead of .4 x 60 = 24. Step 5 incorrectly calculates 120 + 12 + 12 = 144 instead of 120 + 24 + 24 = 168. And step 6 incorrectly calculates 144 / 3 = 48 instead of 168/3=56.The first step to make a mistake, which is the root cause of the mistake, is step 3, so pred_wrong_step is 3.
